item.title: Best CPU Cooler For i5-11600k
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: The Intel Core i5-11600K is one of Intel’s most solid desktop processors. It can handle most of the daily home and office computing tasks flawlessly. It also features a thermal design power of 125W. However, it does not have the required thermal solution, and the maximum allowed temperature is 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For a processor ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The Intel Core i5-11600K is one of Intel’s most solid desktop processors. It can handle most of the daily home and office computing tasks flawlessly. It also features a thermal design power of 125W.

However, it does not have the required thermal solution, and the maximum allowed temperature is 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For a processor as powerful as this one, you may need a CPU cooler. 

To make its performance sustainable, you may have to invest in the best CPU cooler for i5. This way, you can ensure you get the maximum efficiency from your PC.

In this article, we shall look at some of the best CPU coolers for i5-11600K available in the market. Let’s dive into it!

Quick Tips for Shopping Cooler for Your i5 11600k 

Before we indulge in the choices, let’s understand how to pick the best CPU cooler for i5. Here are some important factors you must look for when shopping for this product.

Thermal Design Power

Thermal Design Power or TDP is a vital factor to consider before purchasing a CPU cooler. TDP refers to the amount of heat a CPU produces when it works at its base clock. The TDP of this particular processor is 125 W. 

Hence, check the thermal design power of the cooler before purchasing it. In many cases, the air and liquid coolers specify the rating in their listing. However, if they do not, you can look up about them online.

If you buy a cooler with a lower TDP rating, the fan will function loudly, and the CPU may throttle. It can be damaging to the system in the longer run. So, it is wise to invest in a cooler with higher TDP ratings that run soundlessly and lower your CPU’s temperature significantly.

Types of Coolers

Primarily there are two types of coolers that you can choose from for your CPU. They are air coolers and water coolers.

Air Cooler

Air coolers can be an amazing choice for you if you have a custom desktop or laptop. Moreover, air coolers are the most popular kind of additional coolers when you need more than a stock cooler.

Generally, air coolers are larger than water coolers. Hence, it can not fit perfectly with multiple PC cases. Further, most air coolers, especially aftermarket ones, run at higher speeds and make louder noises.

Water Cooler

Water coolers or liquid coolers are an upgrade to air coolers. Usually, they perform better than air coolers at maintaining the temperature of the processor. Plus, they are available in a wide range of sizes to fit almost any system size.

However, you can avoid this if you do not use your system frequently and do not overheat all that much. Moreover, water coolers can be more expensive and potentially hazardous if the liquid ever leaks. 

Integrated Heat Spreader

Integrated Heat Spreader or IHS is the name for the top silver cover part on a CPU. It is a flat copper plate that protects the core of the CPU. So, why does IHS matter?

It is important because IHS provides a pathway for heat exchange between the cooler and the CPU. It also protects the processing silicon. Usually, soldered IHS is better than unsoldered since it provides a better path for heat exchange.

Thermal Interface Material

Thermal Interface Material or TIM is a very smooth component that bridges the IHS and the cooler. The smoother it is, the better the conductibility of the unit. However, it is very difficult to manufacture a completely smooth TIM. Hence, they use conductive or non-conductive pastes to smoothen it artificially. 

Quiet Operation

Most people prefer a quiet operating system over a noisy one. It is especially true if you are a gamer, graphic designer, or content creator. You would prefer to work in an environment with fewer noisy disturbances.

Therefore, it is a good factor to look for when buying a new cooler for your PC. Moreover, most high-quality coolers ensure to incorporate quiet operation as a feature.

Style

CPU coolers usually stand out in the crowd of numerous components. Hence, it is safe to say the style of the coolers is an important factor to consider. So, do not forget to choose a cooler based on its style after its performance.

Moreover, there are many types of coolers available in the market. They come in a multitude of sizes, shapes, colors, and designs. So, pick what you like so the aesthetic will be pleasing every time you see through the case window.

RGB

Many people prefer a color with an RGB customization option. If you are one of them, you should definitely go for it! You can choose from a wide variety of RGB coolers that offer RGB lighting and fans.

Additionally, it is important to ensure you can turn on and off the RGB whenever you want to. It can have a built-in controller or a compatible motherboard header while you plug it in. 

Nonetheless, it can be helpful when you can turn off the RGB lights without turning off your system.

How Do I Know What Cooler Will Fit in My System?

No matter which type or style of cooler you are opting for, you need to ensure it fits your system. So, how can you know if the cooler you like fits your CPU?

Firstly, you must check for the CPU socket and any potential chassis limitations for cooler height or radiator size for i5 11600k. A socket is a part that provides an electrical and mechanical connection between the motherboard and the processor.

You can check the “Socket Supported” in the CPU package, its official website, or the product listing. Then, compare the socket information, the TPD of the i5 11600k, with the socket info on the cooler. 

If it matches, you know the cooler is going to fit in your system. Moreover, the socket supported for i5-11600k is FCLGA1200.

Installing CPU Cooler for i5-11600k

To ensure you are installing your CPU cooler correctly, I am providing you a guide. Here is a step-by-step process of installing a CPU cooler.

Step #1. Apply Thermal Paste

Before you fix your cooler in your CPU, check for thermal paste. It is a thin layer of a thermal compound that removes the gap between the cooler’s base and the CPU lid. Most coolers come with thermal paste in place, yet not all of them do.

So, if it is not there, you can apply the thermal paste. Remember to apply only a small amount. All you have to do is apply a small dot of the paste in the center of the CPU lid.

Step #2. Set Up Standoffs

This step is an optional step depending on the cooler and motherboard combination. You can use a standoff that screws through the motherboard into the case or a bracket that sits behind the motherboard. 

If the cooler you purchase comes with these components, attach them after seeing if they are appropriate. Also, if you are using a water cooler, you have to install the radiator in your case.

Step #3. Attach the Cooler

Firstly, line up the screws with the holes in the motherboard carefully. Then, lower the cooler into the CPU and screw in the connectors. You can use an X pattern to screw it tight.

Start by tightening loosely at first, then increase the tension as you go on. Make sure to screw in evenly across the board since it can create uneven pressure distribution if you do not. Then, attach any fans or connect them to the radiator depending on the type of cooler.

Step #4. Plug-In

Once you attach everything in the CPY, you have to plug in everything. All parts need power despite the type of cooler. The plugging varies from one cooler to another so that you can connect it according to its design.

Top 5 Best CPU Cooler For i5 11600k: Comprehensive Reviews

Here are my top 5 picks for this list of the best CPU Cooler For i5 11600k. Check out the detailed review on each of these products to know if they suit all your needs!

Best Overall – be quiet! Dark Rock 4, BK021, 200W TDP, CPU Cooler

It has a highly advanced design which can be an excellent upgrade to your old coolers. It has six advanced 6mm copper heat pipes that maximize heat conductance. Moreover, it provides optimized airflow with wave-contoured cooling fins.

This cooler has a single tower layout design that provides excellent heat dissipation even in small spaces. Although only one fan is pre-installed, you can add another 120 mm fan for more cooling. 

It also has an impressive 200W TDP rating that can maintain cool temperature even during my computer’s peak performance.

Conclusion

This cooler offers virtually an inaudible operation with a size-pole motor for less vibration. Moreover, the 200W TDP is perfect for all my requirements, including gaming and editing works.

item.content:encoded:
Are you a big-time i7 11700K fan? Well, why shouldn’t you be? It is crazy affordable and wins over the i9 11900K in the single-thread tests.

On top of this great performance comes the TDP peak of 150W. Yeah, I am thinking the same thing as you are! These statistics mean a hell of a lot of heat. The CPU doesn’t come with an included cooler, and it might get tricky for some of us to choose the best CPU Cooler in the market!

No stress, I am here to help with a comprehensive buying guide of the Best CPU Coolers for i7 11700K! Read on to know more

Quick Buying Guide

I shall now be dictating a few things that you can keep in mind while deciding on the CPU Cooler you need! These factors are essential and generally make or break our decision.

TDP or Thermal Design Power

Well, I can’t say it enough, but TDP matters the most when it comes to CPU Cooler. On a cooler buying spree? Always check for the handleable TDP Value at the back of the product.

Now, you may think, what is this TDP? Thermal design power refers to the maximum heat produced by a processor at its peak performance. 

Now, if the cooler can handle the heat given off by the processor, you’re winning! If not, then my friend, your money might have gone to waste, and I wouldn’t want that for you!

So, make it a rule to check the TDP value of both your CPU and the value your CPU cooler can handle.

Cooler Type

The market has an array of CPU coolers. They might look the same from the top, but let me tell you, they function very differently!

The types are air coolers or Liquid Coolers broadly. Another type is the Open Loop Coolers.

Air Coolers

Air Coolers are the best fit for a low budget and a good investment. The only reason to pick Air coolers is because of the fewer moving parts and easy installation! 

They mainly have metal heatsinks and fans in their composition. A variety of shapes, sizes, and TDP based air coolers are there in the market!

Liquid Coolers

If you can spend a little extra buck on your CPU Cooler, I will surely recommend Liquid Coolers. Even though they are expensive, you get the best of features.

They work at the maximum capacity too with quiet performance! It is in contrast with the functioning of air coolers. 

You won’t have to maintain coolant levels for liquid coolers, and the cooling method will be entirely water-based. With water, you might be stuck at whether there would be any leakage or not? So, guys, no worries, these coolers are leak-resistant!

Additionally, the ease of installation is a bright feature. You can also invest in some overclocking!

Open Loop Coolers

Open Loop Coolers are pricey bets. But the coolest part is that you get top-class results and great cooling abilities.

 On the negative side, the whole build is very complicated and complex. Understanding the specifications of Open Loop Coolers might take some time! 

Socket Compatibility

Next up, we have the factor of CPU Socket compatibility. Imagine you bought a cooler, and now it isn’t able to fit the socket of your CPU. Such a sad story. 

That is why you must always check for a model that can fit your CPU in the best and most effective manner.

RAM Compatibility

RAM compatibility? It sounds like a term you all might have heard. RAM compatibility is an essential part of purchasing a CPU Cooler. The standard RAM Modules that are around 33 mm go well with most CPU Coolers. 

RAM with tall heat spreaders might be the cause of an issue. These RAM modules with greater heights and big cooler models may cause heat sinking. The fan might even overhang RAM Slots.

To prevent such mishaps, do check the compatibility of RAM with your cooler.

Motherboard

So we talked about RAM and Socket Compatibility; what’s next? The motherboard.  Choosing a cooler that can fit the motherboard is essential. 

But the question arises how we can find that out? Go online and find some motherboard compatibility charts! You will be surprised to know the number of them available just to help you make a more balanced decision.

Cooler Height and Case Compatibility

Both the cooler height and case compatibility need to be aligned to have a great CPU cooler fit. You will have to figure out the clearance space for the CPU Cooler. Once you know that, go for a cooler with a similar height or clearance.

Noise

Does a quiet performance impress you? Do you want a great cooling performance? I am hoping the answer to both these questions is a big yes.

Now that we have our priorities set, choosing a cooler becomes an easy job! Generally, a high-performance cooler has low-speed fans and thus less noise. On the other hand, a maxed-out cooler shall have high-speed fans and produce noise when overclocking the CPU.

Overclocking

This term was mentioned previously as well! Overclocking means making the CPU work way faster than the already set limits. High-profile coolers will have the ability to sustain overclocking. Low profile ones only work with the lower TDP CPUs.

I am also attaching a link to a video highlighting some main features to be thoughtful about while making that perfect CPU purchase! Interested? Click on the link below.

Review of the 4 Best CPU Coolers for Intel Core i7 11700K

Noctua NH-D15: Best Overall

Noctua NH D-15 is genuinely the jack of all trades. Whether it’s AMD Ryzen or its Intel, Noctua chooses to win irrespective! But what makes this CPU cooler the great pick that it is?

Noctua NH D-15 comes with two NF-A15 140mm fans. Along with the fans, you get PWM support as well. Imagine these superior quality fans performing at their best capacity with no noise! Sounds like a dream, right? Well, not so much for Noctua.

Noctua provides users the quiet cooling they deserve through this model. The fan also has an automatic speed control. This feature provides the high efficiency required by the cooler.

I cannot skip design when talking about Noctua NH D-15! This CPU cooler has a great design with about six heat pipes and two fans. It also has a high-end NT H1 thermal paste and SecuForm2 mounting system to promote an easy installation.

On top of all these features, Noctua has been a trusted brand for many years. It has won about 250 awards and various recommendations from people all over the globe!

Conclusion

Noctua NH D-15 is a safe bet, in all honesty. Great features with a  great performance. These two things rarely go wrong together. If you have been searching for a great CPU cooler for your Intel core processor, Noctua is a brand you should try at least once!

Scythe Mugen 5 Rev B: Best Budget

I have always been a fan of reasonably priced stuff! Well, who isn’t? We all start to sweat when it comes to CPU coolers, knowing that it will be an expensive deal. What if I tell you that’s not the case? And that you can get a CPU Cooler for less than $ 50?

Hahaha! I know you’re surprised. Scythe Mugen 5 Rev B is the one for you. The price is extremely low, and the features are top-notch.

The 120 mm Kaze Flex Fan performs a variety of functions. It keeps care of the high airflow and static pressure. Along with that, the fans perform in a very quiet manner, even at a high capacity. With Mugen 5, you all can say goodbye to the noise!

There is an additional fan clip in the set too. That is given just in case users want another optional fan. These extra fans promise to give high performance and work in a push-pull configuration. 

Just like Noctua, Scythe also provides users with a thermal compound paste. It is also highly compatible with both AMD Ryzen and Intel. 

As far as CPU Socket compatibility is concerned, Scythe Mugen 5 wins hands down! Yes, we mean it. Scythe Mugen 5 Rev B boasts of a spring-loaded mounting system. This system promotes a more easy and secure installation.

You will also get an asymmetrical design with the product. This design is a great help in the RAM compatibility and the unrestricted access to memory banks.

Conclusion

Life may be tough, but choosing an affordable CPU Cooler isn’t. I recommend you to go for the Scythe Mugen Rev 5. It is a great combination of reasonable prices and high-quality features. Sounds like a nice plan to me!

Arctic Liquid Freezer 11 AIO CPU Cooler: Best Overclocking Cooler 

Do you have a habit of overclocking your system? Are you a big-time gamer who spends long hours online? If you participate in either one of these habits, you will know how big of an issue it is. It becomes difficult to find CPU Coolers that match your requirements. 

Well, All hail Arctic Liquid Freezer AIO CPU cooler to rectify all these worries. This CPU Cooler promises to be way cooler than the other options in the market. It has a more efficient cool plate, pump, and radiator. These components make it a true blue AIO Cpu Cooler.

The CPU Cooler has an additional 40MM VRM Fan attached near the pump. This fan provides cooling to the base and the voltage transformer. The lower voltage Redualtor temperature stands at 15 degrees Celsius, which is pretty great.

Cables are incredibly managed in the Arctic CPU Cooler. The PWM Cable of the fans is put together in sleeved tubing! Overall there is essentially a single cable that users can see on the top of the pump to the motherboard. 

This cooler is a huge relief for all those sick and tired of the cable mess in CPU Coolers.

Another fantastic feature for this CPU cooler would have to have 80% less power consumption! Arctic brings across this new feature which genuinely makes their CPU cooler stand out. 

Now whenever the pumps are idle, they clock down and thus consume way less power. The noise is also minimum whenever cooling isn’t required.

A solid extended warranty backs the whole idea of the Arctic Liquid Freezer AIO CPU cooler. The company offers a six-year warranty from the day of purchase. 

Users won’t have to worry about refilling since the water loop is religiously sealed. It also has high-quality fiber-reinforced EPDM tubing!

Conclusion

If you are a gamer and have a habit of overclocking, this CPU Cooler might just be the solution for you. Arctic Liquid Freezer AIO CPU cooler is made to help users in heat dissipation and provide the best experience ever! 

I am into gaming, and the cool plate of this CPU Cooler is a winner!

On top of that, you get a great build and performance. Additionally, you get all these cool features at a reasonable price as well. So, ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
If you are a gamer or someone with knowledge about CPUs, you will know Ryzen Zen 2 CPU is a top choice! This CPU has eight cores and 16 threads. On top of that, you get a great build and performance.

Additionally, you get all these cool features at a reasonable price as well. So, what’s the issue here? These power-packed CPUs heat up quickly, and you need to cool the temperature to avoid any damage. What do we do now?  Enter CPU Coolers! (They are all you need)

If you’re looking for the best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 7 3700x, we have got you covered. Let’s jump in!

Some Tips to Buy the Perfect CPU Cooler

With the market gushing with options, selecting the correct CPU Cooler can be a tricky job. There are various things to consider, and specifically the features with which these CPU coolers come.

To make things a little short, I have a video here detailing some of the essential points to keep in mind before you spend your hard-earned money. Click on the link below to get enlightened. 

Got a nice idea about choosing the right CPU cooler? Yay, I hope so!

Now, for the people who would rather read to get a descriptive idea of these parameters, read on! 

CPU Cooler Type

The CPU coolers available in the market are broadly divided into air, closed-loop, or all-in-one coolers and, lastly, custom/ open-loop cooling setups. 

Air Coolers 

Air Coolers consist of metal heatsinks and fans. You can buy them in various shapes, sizes and, not to forget, based on thermal dissipation capacities or TDP. 

Open Loop Coolers

Open Loop Coolers are the most expensive options sold in the market; they are extremely complex as well. You might take some time to understand their nitty-gritty.

On the brighter side, Open Loop Coolers tend to provide top-notch results and cooling performance. 

AIO or Closed Loop Coolers

AIO coolers are also referred to as Liquid Coolers. These CPU Coolers are known for their low noise production while working at maximum efficiency. (specifically comparing to air coolers).

For AIO coolers, you won’t have to cut and fit custom tubes. Neither will you have to maintain coolant levels. 

They are even leak-resistant and extremely user-friendly when it comes to the installation part. The only negative is the requirement of the larger case since they need space for a radiator.

CPU Socket

Buying the CPU Cooler and not being able to fit it in your sockets would be such a  waste of money! To save yourself from this misery, almost always choose the cooler model which fits your CPU socket comfortably.

You can go over socket compatibility charts available online to get a clearer idea!

Motherboard

Just like your CPU Socket, the motherboard also plays a big role in CPU Cooler selection. You must look for a Cooler that fits your motherboard. You can check for the details using Motherboard compatibility lists on the internet.

Case Compatibility and Cooler Height

Case Compatibility, along with the cooler heights together, accounts for a perfect CPU Cooler fit. The amount of clearance for coolers will depend on the different PC cases. Make a note of the clearance required by your pick of coolers, or calculate the clearance from the case.

Once you have the desired value of clearance, go for the CPU cooler that fits these specifications.

Ram Compatibility

Standard RAM modules (up to 33 mm) are extremely compatible with almost all cooler models. The issue arises when the user goes for RAM with taller heat spreaders.

Some big cooler models will heat sink themselves, or the fan might overhang the RAM slots on a motherboard when used with RAM Modules of greater heights.

All in all, you should check the popular models and their tendency to overhang the memory slots.

CPU TDP (Thermal Design Power) and Overclocking

The CPU size and design make a lot of difference when choosing a CPU cooler. Generally, big coolers have better cooling performance. These CPU coolers would suit higher TDP CPUs and overclock.

What does overclocking mean, though? Overclocking is the tendency to make your CPU work faster than its stipulated limits. 

Similarly, lower TDP CPUs will work fine with low profile cooler models

Noise

How does noise become a factor here? Well, for starts, as a user, you will, of course, prefer to use a system that works quietly as possible. Cooling performance and noise-making are far more related than you thought. 

A cooler with extra performance headroom for the CPU will have fans with low speeds and less sound.  On the contrary, your CPU’s fully maxed-out cooler shall have fans with high speeds once the CPU is under load.

Keeping all these parameters in mind, you should choose a CPU cooler that matches your CPU’s TDP class, overclocking tendencies and acceptable noise production. 

PCIe Compatibility

Just like I mentioned the CPU slot and motherboard compatibility, PCIe compatibility is a crucial point too. Big coolers may tend to overhang the top PCIe slot. 

How do we figure this out, then? I have observed that the whole compatibility largely depends on the cooler size, top PCIe slot placement, and CPU socket location. 

One should look for compact CPU Coolers that would be compatible in all cases and don’t overhang the top PCIe slot.

So, these are the top factors to be analyzed while buying the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 7 3700X or any other processor for that matter! Next up, I have my personal top 5 CPU coolers to give you the best cooling performance all the time!

Review of the 5 Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 7 3700x

item.content:encoded:
The Ryzen 5 3600 is an amazing 65W chip that is quite a pack of power in a small thermal envelope. Moreover, it provides affordable gaming power to anyone looking for it. 

However, a common issue with Ryzen 5 3600 is it overheats fast. So, the stock cooler Wraith Stealth is not enough. 

In this article, we shall walk through some of the best CPU coolers for Ryzen 5 3600 available in the market. These aftermarket CPU coolers can help you make the best out of the processor’s performance.

Also, I can help you pick the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600 for your requirements. So, let’s get started!

A Quick Buyer’s Guide

Here are some important factors to consider while picking a cooler for Ryzen 5 3600. These factors will ensure you get the best value for your hard-earned money!

Types of Coolers

There are primarily two types of coolers that you can pick from that offer excellent cooling. Here are the primary two categories: Liquid coolers and air coolers.

Liquid Coolers

Liquid coolers or water coolers use distilled water or other liquids to perform cooling. They are generally more effective at maintaining cooler temperatures during peak performance than air coolers. However, they are more difficult to maintain than air coolers.

You can go with liquid coolers if you are a gamer or someone who uses the processors at their peak for a long time. Otherwise, it may simply not be worth the money you pay for since liquid coolers are usually more expensive.

Air Coolers

Air coolers are an excellent alternative for stock coolers. Moreover, air coolers are generally popular than liquid coolers since they are effective and inexpensive.

Further, air coolers are quite larger than water coolers, yet they are available in a wide range of sizes. They also make more noise at higher speeds than liquid or water coolers.

TDP (Thermal Design Power)

TDP is one of the most important factors to consider while investing in a CPU cooler. The TDP for Ryzen 5 3600 is 65W. It refers to the heat a CPU produces when it works at its base clock.

When you are looking for a cooler, ensure the cooler has more TDP than the processor. You can find the TDP rating on the cooler’s product listing. If you do not find it on the product listing or packaging, you can check their official website.

Speed

Speed is an important factor since it plays a vital role in cooling your CPU. The processor is safe when the cooler is propelling air through at an accelerated speed.

Hence, I recommend you choose coolers with a decent spinning speed if it is an air cooler. On the other hand, ensure the liquid component is strong if you plan to purchase a liquid cooler. It should act fast and stay durable for the most efficient temperature reduction.

Noise Levels

The level of noise a cooler produces during its operation is an important factor to acknowledge. If the noise levels of the coolers are too high, it can cause many inconveniences. 

Firstly, it can disturb you with your work. Secondly, the sound waves can interfere with other components in the CPU. Although most high-quality coolers ensure to perform in lowered noises, you may have to discard a good performer for its noise levels.

RGB

RGB is an excellent feature, yet it is only an option. If you are interested in flashy lights that make your PC look edgier. 

However, make sure to prioritize necessary factors such as performance, durability, and noise levels over RGB. On the other hand, if you do not like the flashy lights or think it is unnecessary, you do not have to waste your time on this feature.

Ease of Installation

Usually, AIO (All in One) coolers are more complex to install than a standard cooler. However, the ease of installation depends on the model of the cooler and your processor. Hence, it is important to pick a cooler that is easy to install on your PC.

Water or liquid coolers are more difficult to install than air coolers. It is so because it involves an extra step of installing the radiator and fans.

Size

Air coolers are generally bulkier than water coolers. However, the entire structure stays on one area instead of liquid coolers that you have to distribute across the system. You will need space for the radiator, and it has to be in the proper orientation.

Hence, if you want something effective, you can go with air coolers in a small area. Moreover, they are available in a wide range of sizes. If you want a low-profile air cooler and have enough space for alignment, you go with liquid coolers.

Preview Product Rating Price
Corsair H115i RGB Platinum AIO Liquid CPU Cooler,280mm,Dual ML140... 7,670 Reviews Buy now
Noctua NH-L12S, Premium Low Profile CPU Cooler with Quiet 120mm... 1,346 Reviews $59.95 Buy now

Noctua NH-D15, Premium CPU Cooler with 2X NF-A15 PWM 140mm Fans... 9,219 Reviews $99.95 Buy now

Are Air Coolers Better Than Liquid Coolers?

Generally, liquid coolers are better than air coolers. However, it entirely depends on the manufacturing quality and design of the cooler. 

Usually, liquid coolers have many exclusive features that make the cooling more efficient. Yet both the type of coolers are highly effective if you implement them properly. However, entry-level liquid coolers can be substantially expensive.

Should You Replace the Liquid in Liquid Coolers Often?

No, you do not have to replace it often or at any time. It requires less interaction since the coolers have auto-renew technology. In this technology, they renew the liquid automatically using flush methods.

How to Install a CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 3600?

It is quite easy to install a cooler for Ryzen 5 3600. I have mentioned a few pointers in a step-by-step manner below to help you with the installation.

Apply the thermal paste if it is not already there. You will have to start by unscrewing the pre-attached brackets on the motherboard.

Then, you will have to mount the cooler. You can mount it away from the RAM to have fewer RAM clearance issues.

Place the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600 you pick and screw it in a diagonal pattern. Also, apply some pressure while tightening the screws as they are spring-loaded. Yet remember to tighten it gradually without pressuring it too much.

Finally, once you ensure it is properly in place, you can connect the fan header to the motherboard’s CPU fan header. Then, plug in everything that you should.

Top 5 Best CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 3600

Let’s check out five of my top picks for the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600. I have presented a detailed review of each of these choices. Plus, I have included a list of pros and cons.

Best Overall Cooler – Corsair H115i RGB Platinum AIO Liquid CPU Cooler

First, on my list of the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600, I have Corsair H115i RGB Platinum AIO Liquid CPU Cooler. Let’s take a closer look at its features and find out what’s special about this cooler. 

It is one of the most popular water coolers available in the market for its high performance and excellent airflow capacity. It has an RGB magnetic levitation PWM fan that delivers improved airflow along with a beautiful blast of colors. The airflow is 97 CFM, which is pretty impressive.

Furthermore, it has individually controlled RGB LED lights that you can use to produce customized lighting effects. Its CORSAIR iCUE software lets you control the lighting. It also allows you to adjust coolant temperatures and fans.

You can expect high performance and low noise cooling with the thermally optimized plate. The fans can also run between the speeds of 400 to 2400 rpm. Finally, it is very easy to install, which is an important feature.

Conclusion

It is a high-performing cooler suitable for Ryzen 5 3600. Further, you can customize the stunning RGB colors along with fan speed. Plus, it has a thermally optimized cold plate with a low noise pump.

It has 6 x 6 mm heat pipes and a copper plate base. This feature will ensure better heat dissipation and cooling. Moreover, these coolers are very easy to install with their spring-loaded mounting system. 

Conclusion

You can pick this if you are looking for a very easy cooler highly-priced to install and work efficiently. The high airflow capacity (51.17 cubic feet per minute) ensures better cooling. Further, I appreciate its push-pull configuration, which helps during long hours of work.

item.title: How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: Best Coolers And Buying Guide
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: We cannot underestimate the importance of proper processor cooling, altering the computer’s performance and stability. It also impacts the amount of PC usage and the possibility of overclocking the processor. The CPU is highly vulnerable to high temperatures, especially if exposed to them for an extended period. Therefore, throttling or simply lowering CPU power is ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
We cannot underestimate the importance of proper processor cooling, altering the computer’s performance and stability. It also impacts the amount of PC usage and the possibility of overclocking the processor.

The CPU is highly vulnerable to high temperatures, especially if exposed to them for an extended period. Therefore, throttling or simply lowering CPU power is this component’s first line of protection. 

Other implications include unreliable system performance, automatic restarts, and, finally, permanent processor damage. As a result, we have to dissipate the created heat somehow, using the CPU coolers.

How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: First and foremost, you must determine the CPU socket on your motherboard. For attaching the CPU cooler, different sockets have different holes. Most coolers, on the whole, feature universal, adjustable systems that allow them to the mounting holes. It is, nonetheless, worth examining for certainty and security.

What else is there to say? First, of course, there’s the scale. You may find the dimensions of each air cooling in the product specification. 

It’s worth comparing this to the housing dimensions and the maximum height of the cooler that can fit inside such a box. The fact that some memory chips may not fit under the heat sink is also a prevalent issue.

What Is The Function Of A Cpu Cooler?

The air conditioning system’s functioning is reasonably straightforward. First, the processor’s heated core radiates heat to the IHS (so-called caps). The heat sink base catches it, which spreads them across its whole surface. Finally, they aided the heat pipes, which, when filled with a particular liquid or gas, use the convection phenomenon to convey waste heat (matter movement).

The procedure may come to an end here, depending on whether we have passive or active cooling. First, the air circulation cools the heat sink in the housing in passive coolers. Then, in current ones, the use of those fans compelling this movement. Next, even more.

How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: What Should You Look For In A Cooling Fan?

The fan is the most significant aspect of the design, irrespective of whether we select air (active) and water cooling. It is the fan that facilitates heat transfer from the radiator and cooler. So which CPU fan is the most suitable? It’s essential to pay attention to a few variables here.

Rotational Size & Speed

First and foremost, the size or speed of rotation – the greater the total flow or, the better the fan efficiency, the greater they are. However, it’s important to note that higher speeds commonly result in a more significant level of created noise. Therefore, it includes a fan with LED illumination in the CPU cooler for gamers.

Design Of The Bearing

The bearing utilized has a significant impact on the noise produced and the structure’s durability. In addition, we should consider the fan’s connection – newer models use a 4-pin plug that allows you to manage the rotation speed, for example, from the motherboard.

Is It Better To Use Aluminum Or Copper As A Heat Sink?

We may locate a heat sink for the processor in two variants: aluminum or copper, in both air coolers and water coolers. The first is significantly more common, especially in lower-cost structures. On the other hand, copper heat sinks are not widely used, and they were paired with aluminum heat sinks due to their physical qualities, yet they provide higher performance. However, they are, unfortunately, more expensive than the conventional ones.

The thermal paste is also a significant component of cooling. Therefore, we can employ both types of heat sinks with the most popular mixes.

CPU Cooling: Active Or Passive?

When should active cooling be used, more excellent, and when should passive cooling be used? How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: It all depends on our personal choices for computer work culture:

Using a fan in active coolers, which improves heat dissipation efficiency but also generates noise.

Because passive designs are fanless, they operate in perfect silence. Thus they’re worth noting if you’re looking for quiet CPU cooling.

It’s worth noting, though, that passive CPU cooling has restricted performance, so they’ll only function with low-performance standard processors.

What CPU Is Cooler Simple To Set Up?

Finally, there’s the matter of assembling; the rule of thumb here is that the smaller the item, the easier it is to install.

Because a good CPU cooler is more sophisticated, installation can be more difficult. Installing new cooling can often need removing the entire motherboard from the casing (must screw the CPU cooler mounting brackets from the bottom of the board). If we do not want or cannot disassemble the entire computer, it is worthwhile to pay attention to such criteria. However, this is not a rule because, in most circumstances, you may easily install a home processor cooling system.

item.content:encoded:
Recently, Intel introduced its latest flagship, specifically designed for the CPU that is Intel core i9-11900k. However, the 11th-gen Rocket Lake build newer cores used in its 10th-gen notebook CPUs. If you want to enhance the use of Core i9-11900K, when you have to use a cooler for i9-11900K to get a full 360mm radiator. 

The 11th Gen Intel Core processor family uses the latest Cypress Cove microarchitecture cores to improve efficiency and performance. According to Intel, the new architecture brings an increase in the performance compared to similar models of the 10th generation and even capable of operating at higher frequencies.

What are CPU coolers?

Processor coolers remove excess heat generated by computer components. The CPU coolers for i9-11900k gives guaranteeing proper temperature maintenance for a running PC. Remember that too much heat can damage your CPU.  It might even lead to a chain reaction that will create more problems for the computer. Of course, powerful computers require more efficient coolers. Those who are looking for products with a good capacity will have to invest in an adequate model.

Finding the perfect CPU cooler for 11th gen can seem difficult. If there are many processors or multiple choices, for this manner you must choose the 11th gen. It should be understood that some coolers are suitable for certain constructions, while others are not necessarily. 

The main task of the CPU cooler is to prevent essential components rigs and enhance the rig lifetime by ensuring that everything is under control within the safe temperature band. The cooler depletes the i9-11900k processor heat through a huge surface area and utilizes its liquid-based system to keep it operational as well as cool.

The basic principle to choose CPU coolers:

Air or liquid CPU coolers? Which brand to choose from? These are questions that bother many newbies. The best CPU coolers for i9-11900 may vary from model to model. You will have to choose between an air cooler or a liquid cooler.

  • Air-cooled CPU coolers

The most common form of processor cooling is the air cooling CPU cooler. The equipment uses fans because of their efficiency and low cost. In fact, the best CPU air cooler for the 11th gen is versatile enough that it can handle intense processing.

  • Liquid CPU coolers

Liquid CPU coolers for 11th gen offer better performance compared to the model. Liquid cooling can conjure up the image of hardcore technicians running PCs with crazy configurations.

Power users and over clockers are more inclined to go for that extra heat reduction offered by liquid cooling. While many gamers don’t want to install a liquid setup, many of the best CPU liquid coolers prove to be fairly easy to integrate with standard PC versions.

Liquid cooling systems are generally quieter because they push heat out of the case rather than inside like air systems. Their better thermal conductivity allows for more cooling with less fan power.

How to choose the best CPU cooler for i9-11900k?

Most standard CPU coolers for i9-11900k comes with inexpensive aluminum instead of the higher-performing copper heatsinks. So if you are looking for good cooling and less noise for your microprocessor, you will need to invest in a better-performing cooling system. You can keep these important points in mind that will help you get the best first-class coolers for your i9-11900k:

  • Premium quality: 

First of all, you need to choose the best CPU cooler for i9-11900k that shows superior quality. Look for the option that is recommended by a large number of people. Also, the chosen model must have an expanded design and be equipped with dual fans. 

  • High compatibility:

Also, have the best CPU cooler for i9-11900k, which shows high RAM compatibility if installed with single fan mode. It should have recessed bottom fins and show wide compatibility with some of the premium and high-end RAM modules.

  • Secured mounting system:

Experts have recommended getting their hands on that CPU cooler for 11th gen that shows a secure mounting system, and in this way, users can get features of safety, quality, and ease of use. Furthermore, a secure and firm mounting system offers the appearance of perfect contact pressure and maximum user comfort.

Things to look at the time of buying

Performance:

When buying a cooler for 11th gen, first, check its performance and capacity of cooling. It is also important to consider installing the different components that take part in the cooling system’s influence and performance. 

Sound:

Unless you have a passive heatsink, and the cooling system will make noise due to the presence of fans that expel heat, some outside the component or even outside the case. The noise will depend on the size, number, and power of the fans that the system incorporates, which must be reflected in the product’s technical specifications. It will also depend on how much heat the system has to dissipate; the higher the CPU is; the more revolutions the fan will have to reach to expel the heat from the component.

Size:

The dimensions of a cooler for i9-11900k will depend on the model that we want to choose. However, the size is only limited to the area near the CPU, while the most powerful heatsinks are typically larger. With a liquid cooling system, you will have to make room for the radiator on one side of the case. The all-in-one liquid cooling or low-profile heatsink with a small radiator gives the desired space that the airflow from your computer doesn’t stop.

Ease of installation

Air cooling systems are the easiest to install; after all, all you have to do on all models is tighten the screws connected to the CPU and the motherboard. This does not mean that AOI liquid cooling systems are also very easy to install since when they come fully assembled, we will only have to worry about coupling the fan to the computer case and the cooling unit to the CPU.

Of course, in both cases, you will have to consider the dimensions of your computer case and the rest of the components to see if the system fits without problems. However, when we talk about custom liquid cooling systems, things change since the assembly and maintenance of these systems must always be left to the experts. Although they can be much more customizable and versatile, they are not recommended for people who do not experience this field.

Price:

If we start searching for a cooler for 11th gen, we can find basic and premium versions, either for liquid or air cooling systems. In general, air cooling is cheaper in both the most basic and advanced models. 

However, OIA liquid cooling is becoming cheaper, and it will end up being standardized in all equipment. The best suggestion is to buy a cooler for i9-11900k that seems budget-oriented.

Editor’s choice:

Noctua brand is known for better CPU cooler for i9-11900k; that’s why I recommend this CPU cooler model. Another reason for recommended Noctua NH-D15 is that Premium CPU Cooler is praised by many world-class hardware websites.

How Do I Pick a Good CPU Cooler for i9-11900k?

Having decided on the type of equipment needed to cool your system fully, you should pay attention to the following aspects. If you do not know how to choose a cooler for 11th gen processor, please note that we only disclose the key parameters, but we cannot give any recommendations, not knowing what kind of hardware you have. So:

Radiator: Today, aluminum models are found less and less; copper is more often used. The second material has better thermal conductivity and guarantees more efficient heat dissipation.

The number of heat pipes: These elements contain a low-boiling liquid, which evaporates and condenses at the other end, which will allow removing unnecessary heat from the source and transferring it to the radiator. Inexpensive active coolers, there are up to 6 such elements, whereas in premium ones, there are more than six.

Mounting method: To install passive and active coolers, you can use latches, double-sided mount types, bolts, and silicone mounts. The latter option is prioritized due to vibration absorption.

Fan quality: The most common 120mm fans can have different bearings: sliding, rolling, and fluid dynamics. The last bearings are filled with a special fluid that guarantees good mobility during the fan’s rotation.

Turnovers: The lower the minimum – the wider the adjustment range, the higher – the more effective. In this case, the diameter is closely related to the size of the fan. It is considered the norm from 1000 to 2500 rpm.

Therefore, it is worth paying attention to any modernization of the cooling system; otherwise, the consequences can range from excessive spending of money to overheating the Northbridge or processor power supplies. However, competently assembled cooling will give both silence and a constant temperature of the processor.

Final words

The above are some of the best CPU Coolers for Intel Core i9-11900K.

The Intel Core i9-11900k comes with the most powerful CPU system that boosts speed because of its high degree bound performance of single-core CPU.

Most gamers didn’t recognize that they didn’t spend extra charges to acquire a high-end processor cooler for i9-11900k. In fact, they don’t even think that a valuable CPU cooler brings a positive experience and enhances the CPU life.

Thus, despite the fact that coolers are secondary or not tertiary parts in any system, their purchase must be approached with all seriousness. There are a lot of factors to consider: from the size of the fan to the backlight. item.title: Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 9 5950X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: Finally, AMD just released their new lineup of Ryzen 5000 series Zen3 CPUs, which will provide unparalleled gaming and single-core dependent content creation performance. The flagship CPU of this new series of processors: The Ryzen 9 5950X contains two maxed out core complexes (CCX), with eight cores and 32 MB of L3 cache; for a ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Finally, AMD just released their new lineup of Ryzen 5000 series Zen3 CPUs, which will provide unparalleled gaming and single-core dependent content creation performance.

The flagship CPU of this new series of processors: The Ryzen 9 5950X contains two maxed out core complexes (CCX), with eight cores and 32 MB of L3 cache; for a total of 16 cores, 32 threads, and 64 MB of level 3 cache. The CPU operates at speeds of 3.4 GHz, but can be overclocked to an impressive 4.9 GHz, given that it has sufficient cooling.

Despite the price increase for all of the new Zen3 CPUs, none of the three higher-end models – Ryzen 7 5800X, Ryzen 9 5900X and Ryzen 9 5950X – will include a thermal solution in their package.

Luckily, there are several exceptional CPU coolers in the market, by means of both air cooling and AIO liquid cooling. Due to the high performance of the Ryzen 9 5950X, its cooler must be capable of equivalently powerful performance, so only the best models available in the market will do for this flagship processor.

To help you find the most compatible cooler for the Ryzen 9 5950X and your individual preferences, we’ve compiled a list of all the best the market has to offer –  according to mode of cooling, price, style, and performance.

Read Also: Best Motherboards for Ryzen 9 5950X

Best CPU Coolers for the AMD Ryzen 9 5950X

Preview Product Rating Price

Best Air CPU Cooler for Ryzen 9 5950X – Noctua NH-D15

When it comes to air coolers, nothing competes with Noctua’s NH-D15. This high-end CPU cooler has proven its worth time and time again, and its benchmarks (carried out by TweakTown) display not only its superior cooling ability, but also its low noise emissions.

The NH-D15 achieves these metrics via the use of two NF-A15, 140 mm, fans that are equipped with SSO2 magnetic levitation bearings. The NF-A15 fans output a static pressure of 1.51 mmH2O and 68 CFM of airflow each, with a maximum of 1,200 rotations per minute (RPM).

The low rotations and the magnetic bearings allow for silent operation of below 35 decibels (dB), as well as a meant time between failures (MTBF) of 150,000 hours – backed by a six-year warranty. Finally, the heatsink is all aluminum, and it makes vicarious contact with the CPU via six nickel-plated heat pipes and a pre-applied, top-of-the-line, Noctua NT-H1 thermal paste.

The NH-D15 can be found for a modest $89.95, which is a small price to pay for cooling the Ryzen 9 5950X’s intense performance.

Best Upgradeable Air CPU Cooler for Ryzen 9 5950X – Noctua NH-U14S

The Ryzen 9 5950X does not come cheap, and nor do all the other hardware components it needs in order to run optimally, which is why you may be shopping for a CPU cooler on a budget. Worry not, as Noctua has you covered with the NH-U14S: A cooler capable of chilling the R9 5950X, and that can also be upgraded with an additional fan, if you need some extra cooling power down the line.

Like all Noctua coolers, the NH-U14S proves its worth in both CPU temperatures, as well as remarkably low noise levels, in real-world benchmarks via the use of its premium built fans. The included NF-A15 is identical to that included with the NH-D15 and has a similar MTBF of 150,000 hours.

The NH-U14S’s slim, 52 mm, full-aluminum heatsink, is made so that it doesn’t interfere with any RAM modules; making it an easy fit for any setup. The best aspect of the NH-U14S is that it has all the necessary components needed to house a second NF-A15 – or any other 140 mm – fan, if need be.

The Noctua NH-U14S can be found for only $63.75, while an additional NF-A15 fan will cost an additional $21.95; an exceptional price for the performance delivered, with or without the second fan.

Best Performance AIO Cooler for Ryzen 9 5950X – Corsair H115i RGB Platinum

Liquid, all-in-one (AIO), coolers are a stylish and efficient way of cooling a CPU and, when it comes to performance, few can rival Corsair’s H115i RGB Platinum: A CPU cooler with performance proven in real-world benchmarks.

Making use of Corsair’s premium ML140 Pro 140 mm fans, which include magnetic levitation bearings and PWM controls, the H115i RGB Platinum chills the CPU via the back and forth motion of a liquid which circulates between the head-pump and the 280 mm radiator. The liquid is heated by the CPU, then cooled by the fans which can output a static pressure of 1.27 mm H2O, and an impressive airflow of 97 CFM; operating at speeds between 400 and 2,000 RPM. The fans also feature eight individually controlled LEDs, while the pump head has 16 LEDs, all of which can be synchronized via Corsair’s iCUE software.

The H115i RGB Platinum has three preset modes: Quiet, Balanced, and Extreme, with the CPU maintaining optimal temperatures and low noise levels during both Quiet and Balanced modes, according to benchmarks.

For $169.99, this CPU cooler offers both style and function and can be found in an Elite Capellix variant for the same price.

Best RGB AIO Cooler for Ryzen 9 5950X – Thermaltake Water 3.0 ARGB

If you want to take AIO cooling to the extreme, both in size and in RGB pizazz, then the Thermaltake Water 3.0 ARGB cooler is exactly what you need. With three 120 mm fans and a 360 mm radiator, the Water 3.0 ARGB is massive. Benchmarks (by KitGuru) show sub-70 C° CPU temperatures throughout all testing and a noise level that maxes out at 46.5 dB.

The Thermaltake Water 3.0 ARGB makes use of three nine-blade fans with hydrodynamic bearings, capable of 56.45 CFM airflow and 1.59 mmH2O static pressure production. Due to their hydraulic bearings, as well as the pumps reinforced sleeves and low-evaporation tubing, this CPU cooler offers a level of longevity not usually found in AIO coolers.

 Each of the three fans also comes equipped with nine addressable LEDs, capable of displaying 16.8 million colors that can be customized through either a physical controller, or any ASUS, Gigabyte, MSI, or ASRock RGB synchronization software.

The Thermaltake Water 3.0 ARGB can be currently be found for $163.99, down from its original $179.99 price tag.

item.title: Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 7 5800X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: The new AMD Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs have been announced, and gaming enthusiasts now have a new CPU to look forward to. Maximizing the potential of the previous Zen 2 generation processors, these CPUs hold the crowns for the best gaming and best content creation CPUs, all in one. The CPU that is looking to ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The new AMD Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs have been announced, and gaming enthusiasts now have a new CPU to look forward to. Maximizing the potential of the previous Zen 2 generation processors, these CPUs hold the crowns for the best gaming and best content creation CPUs, all in one. The CPU that is looking to become the best value of all Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs is the Ryzen 7 5800X – especially when it comes to gaming.

What differentiates these Zen 3 processors, from previous AMD CPUs, is that they have expanded CCXs (Core Complex) that are able to hold 8 cores and 32 MB of Level 3 cache – up from the 4 core and 16 MBs of the Zen 2 CCX. This means that inter-core latency is drastically reduced, which is especially important for gaming and single-core performance. Due to the fact that gaming applications will not use more than eight cores and 16 threads – nor will they in the foreseeable future, as this is also the limitation of next-generation gaming consoles – means that having a multiple CCX Ryzen CPU (like the R9) will inevitably become redundant. This is also apparent in the fact that the gaming benchmarks are shown for the Ryzen 9 5900X and Ryzen 9 5950X displays an almost equal performance (with some games even favoring the R9 5900X) in comparison to the i9-10900K. This only goes to show that anything more than the necessary core and thread counts will provide little to any enhancement in FPS for gaming.

The Ryzen 7 5800X has one maximized CCX, which is really all that is needed for a top-level performance for several years to come. Of course, it must be said, that AMD has increased the prices of their Ryzen CPUs, compared to the launch prices of Zen 2, and this time around they also will not include a stock cooler (the only exception being the Ryzen 5 5600X).

When purchasing a CPU cooler, it is wise to invest as much as possible, because the CPU cooler will not only allow you to maximize the power of your processor’s overclocking capabilities, but it will also last for several upgrades of the CPU. That is why we’ve compiled a list of the best CPU coolers to pair with the Ryzen 7 5800X based on both price and performance.

This CPU cooler makes use of a single 120 mm Scythe Kaze Flex fan that outputs an airflow of 51.17 CFM and static pressure of 1.05 mmH2O, utilizing fluid dynamic ball bearings that provide an incredibly low noise level of under 30 decibels –while maintaining a standard lifetime of 120,000 hours. When TweakTown put the Scythe Mugen 5 Rev.

B to the test, it surprisingly performed very close to CPU coolers that are upwards of twice its price. Additionally, it is the only cooler that was tested that did not exceed 30 decibels, even at overclocked loads (12V).

Not only will this cooler last, but it can also be upgraded by mounting a second 120 mm fan; so it is not just affordable, it is also futureproofed. You can find the Scythe Mugen 5 Rev.B for only $48.99 – a no brainer for those looking to chill the Ryzen 7 5800X without breaking the bank.

The best airflow CPU cooler that money can buy, the Noctua NH-D15 brings cooling, longevity, and silent operation all in one. It provides enough cooling performance for any Ryzen 5000 Series, or even Threadripper CPU, so the Ryzen 7 5800X is more than safe with this cooler.

The NH-D15 makes use of Noctua’s premium NF-A15 140 mm fans, which output 1.51 mmH2O of static pressure and 68 CFM of airflow each – while operating at just 1,200 RPM.

Their low rotation speed, paired with the SSO2 magnetic bearings, make the NH-D15 the most silent double fan CPU cooler in the market. Benchmarks prove it to operate between 24 and 35 decibels, the latter measurement being when 12 Volts were supplied, so it is virtually inaudible from a foot away. The SSO2 magnetic bearings also account for the incredible MTBF it holds of 150,000 hours, backed by a 6-year warranty.

The Noctua NH-D15 currently sells for only $89.95 – a worthy investment that will last several iterations of CPUs to come.

item.title: Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 5 5600X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: With the release of AMD’s highly anticipated Ryzen 5000 series CPUs, many people are excited to upgrade (or build new) PCs that utilize the workstation and gaming performance of these new-generation CPUs. Despite seeing the highest increase in price (in the leap from Zen 2 to Zen 3) the Ryzen 5 5600X has no equal ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
With the release of AMD’s highly anticipated Ryzen 5000 series CPUs, many people are excited to upgrade (or build new) PCs that utilize the workstation and gaming performance of these new-generation CPUs.

Despite seeing the highest increase in price (in the leap from Zen 2 to Zen 3) the Ryzen 5 5600X has no equal when it comes to content creation and gaming performance in the entry-level CPU market. The only CPU that can come close to matching its performance (in gaming) is Intel’s 10th generation i5-10600K(F). This CPU, which is $40-$60 cheaper in price, is not PCIe 4.0 compatible, and it has nearly double the TDP (thermal design power) demand – meaning that even if it did perform on the same level as the Ryzen 5 5600X (which chances are it won’t), the price difference would be recuperated from the difference in power consumption alone.

The Ryzen 5 5600X also includes a stock cooler, absent from the i5-10600K: The AMD Wraith Stealth. Though it’s great that AMD includes a stock cooler with the $300 dollar purchase of the Ryzen 5 5600X (it being the only CPU of the Ryzen 5000 Series that comes with a cooler so far), still, many will find that the Wraith Stealth is not to their liking, as Techspot’s benchmarks show us how this stock cooler can lack the cooling power necessary to maintain optimal CPU temperatures for Ryzen processors – while also being quite noisy.

Luckily enough, there are several CPU coolers that can provide great performance, low noise emissions, and fit into any form factor at fairly low prices. To find the best CPU cooler to pair with the new Ryzen 5 5600X, we’ve compiled a list of four coolers that can work for those on a budget, those looking for maximum performance, those looking for a low-profile cooler, and even those that prefer AIO liquid coolers – all at under $100.

Read Also: Best Motherboard for the Ryzen 5 5600X

Best CPU Coolers for the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X

Best Budget CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 5600X – Arctic Freezer 7X

If you’re looking to replace the stock Wraith Stealth without breaking the bank, then the Arctic offers a great cooler for only $24: The Arctic Freezer 7X.

This cooler makes use of a 92 mm, PWM controlled, fan that cools a 44-fin heatsink which, in turn, comes in contact with the CPU via two double-sided 6 mm, direct touch, copper heat pipes that have a pre-applied MX-2 high-performance thermal paste on the baseplate.

Benchmarks run by Ponchato show us that, when supplied with 1.35V, the Arctic Freezer 7X will have the Ryzen 3 3300X cooled to temperatures 20 degrees Celsius below that of the Wraith Stealth (44.5 vs 65.3) when regulated to run at a 40-decibel noise level.

For its $23.99 price tag and its overall performance, the Arctic Freezer 7X is definitely a worthy pairing with the new Ryzen 5 5600X.

Best Performance CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 5600X – Noctua NH-U12S

If you plan to overclock the Ryzen 5 5600X on a regular basis, you will need all the extra cooling power you can get to keep its performance high and stable. For this task, we recommend Noctua’s mid-range NH-U12S CPU cooler.

The NH-U12S features a 120 mm NF-F12 fan, which outputs 2.61 mmH2O of static pressure (air pressure meant for penetrating through heatsinks) that makes use of SSO2 magnetic ball bearings for increased longevity and low noise emission.

The NH-U12S has proven to keep a Ryzen 7 3700X at below 66 degrees Celsius during a blender stress test by TechPowerUp; while TweakTown also displays benchmarks that show the cooler outputting only 40 decibels of noise when supplied with 12 V of electromotive force. 

It’s also important to mention, that the NH-U12S can be upgraded by adding a second 120 mm fan of your choice – though the Ryzen 5 5600X will surely not require this upgrade, as the NH-U12S has more than enough power to keep it cool.

This Noctua cooler has a MTBF (mean time between failures) of 150,000 hours, and includes a 6-year warranty.

The NH-U12S can currently be found for as low as $59.95: A must buy for those looking to maximize the power of the Ryzen 5 5600X.

Best Low-Profile CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 5600X – Scythe Big Shuriken 3

When it comes to low-profile CPU-cooling, few can compete with Scythe’s Big Shuriken 3. This CPU cooler is capable of not only cooling the Ryzen 5 5600X, but it can cool any Ryzen 5000 series processor with the use of its upgrade capacity.

The Big Shuriken 3 utilizes a 15 mm thick, 120 mm, Scythe Kaze Flex slim fan, bringing its overall height to 69 mm. This PWM-controlled, fluid dynamic bearing fan offers a sufficient amount of cooling at noise levels that will not exceed 35 decibels – as proven by TweakTown’s benchmarks.

But if you wish to enhance its cooling capabilities, and lessen the noise output, even more, you can replace the Scythe Kaze Flex slim fan with a Noctua NF-12×25 fan (which adds 10 mm of thickness), as the Big Shuriken allows you to replace the mounted fan to one of your likings.

You can currently find Scythe’s Big Shuriken 3 for only $46.99, and if you do decide to replace the fan, you can find the NF-12×25 for $29.90.

Best Budget AIO Cooler for Ryzen 5 5600X – Corsair Hydro Series H60

If you like the idea of keeping your CPU liquid-cooled, then nothing beats the pocket-sized beast known as the Corsair Hydro Series H60.

This small form factor compatible AIO liquid cooler includes a 120 mm Corsair SP Series PWM fan, which pumps out 57.2 CFM that is used to chill its accompanying 120 mm all-aluminum radiator (includes an IP32 certification for water and dust resistance). In fact, TweakTown shows us that the Hydro Series H60 will even outperform full-sized AIO liquid coolers in real-world benchmarks, and does so with a noise level peaking at 47-64 decibels, at high loads.

For additional style, the pump head has a white monochrome LED display with Corsair’s logo. If you want a liquid cooler with additional RGB pizzazz, there is always the CoolerMaster MasterLiquid ML120L ($64.99) but keep in mind that it does not perform anywhere near the level of the Hydro Series H60.

The Corsair Hydro Series H60 is currently selling for $79.16, which is an excellent deal for a high performing AIO liquid cooler on a budget.

item.title: Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 9 5900X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: The long-awaited Zen 3 processors have finally been announced, and despite maintaining an identical number of cores and threads with the Zen 2 Ryzen 3000 series CPUs, these processors will see a huge increase in performance – especially with regards to gaming. This is accomplished by changing the architecture of the cores, threads, and L3 ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The long-awaited Zen 3 processors have finally been announced, and despite maintaining an identical number of cores and threads with the Zen 2 Ryzen 3000 series CPUs, these processors will see a huge increase in performance – especially with regards to gaming.

This is accomplished by changing the architecture of the cores, threads, and L3 cache of the processor – a method AMD seems to have tested with their Ryzen 3 3300X. Each CCD (Chiplet Die) will have CCX (Core Complexes) within, from which inter-core communication occurs, including utilization of the L3 cache. In Zen 2 Ryzen CPUs, each CCX could contain up to 4 Cores and up to 16 MB of L3 Cache. This caused the need for the cores to communicate through with other CCXs, resulting in larger inherent inter-core latency. With the new Ryzen 5000 series CPUs, each CCX can hold twice the number of cores and twice the L3 Cache: that is 8 cores and 32 MB of L3 cache. For latency dependent workloads and applications, one of which is gaming, one can expect to see a significant increase in performance, as well as an IPC uplift of 19% and faster single and core & single thread performance; all while maintaining an equally low TDP (Thermal Design Power) with previous generation CPUs. By focusing on optimizing their existent cores and threads, AMD can now claim to have both the best consumer workstation and gaming processors.

One thing that the AMD Zen 3 Ryzen CPUs do not have, is a stock CPU cooler. So, if you are looking to upgrade to one of the new processors, like the Ryzen 9 5900X, you are going to need to purchase a cooler. Investing in a powerful cooler is always a wise decision to make, as they prevent the CPU from overheating, and allow you to push the processor to its overclocking limits – and can continue to do so even after you upgrade your CPU again. Therefore, having a cooler that can keep CPU temperatures low, limit the amount of noise emissions, and at the same time maintain a long lifespan, if of utmost importance.

That is why we’ve chosen the best CPU coolers for Ryzen 9 5900X CPU – including an air cooler, an AIO cooler, and even a low-profile cooler for SFF builds.

Read Also: Best Motherboard for Ryzen 9 5900X

Best Budget CPU Cooler for Ryzen 9 5900X – Noctua NH-U12S

When it comes to air coolers, no one beats Noctua. This company’s products not only provide the best cooling performance, but they also emit the least amount of noise and have heatsinks that provide exceptional heat dissipation.

For the Ryzen 9 5900X, the best CPU cooler, on a budget, is the NH-U12S. This cooler features a single 120 mm PWM controlled fan, that can output an impressive 2.61 mmH2O while spinning at up to 1,500 RPM. The PWM controls mean that the fan will only spin when temperatures require it to, so at low loads the cooler will be inaudible.

Still, even at high loads, the SSO2 magnetic bearings featured in the fans emit a maximum of only 26-40 decibels (benchmarked) – which ranges from virtually silent, to the sound of a whisper at one foot away. The magnetic bearings also guarantee endurance, as the cooler includes a 6-year warranty and an MTBF of 150,000 hours.

The NH-U12S also includes Noctua’s top-of-the-line NT-H1 thermal paste, and can even be upgradeable by installing a second 120mm fan.

The Noctua NH-U12S currently sells for $59.95, which is an excellent price for what it has to offer.

Best Air CPU Cooler for Ryzen 9 5900X – Noctua NH-D15

Going one step above the NH-U12S, Noctua features the high-end NH-D15 – and this is by far the best air cooler the industry has to offer. Not only is it more than powerful enough to cool the mid-to-high-end Ryzen 9 5900X, but it can even be used for cooling AMD’s professional-grade Threadripper processors.

This fan features two NF-A15 140 mm fans – outputting a static pressure of 1.51 mmH2O each, as well as 68 CFM of airflow – operating at a max RPM of 1,200. Like the aforementioned NH-U12S, this cooler also has SSO2 magnetic bearings and Noctua’s NT-H1 thermal paste. In addition, it has a massive, all-aluminum, heatsink with six direct contact nickel plated heatpipes.

Benchmarks carried out by TweakTown show us how this CPU cooler not only outperforms its competitors, some of which are twice as expensive, but it’s also the most quiet, and still maintains an MTBF of 150,000 hours.

You can currently find the NH-D15 for $89.95 – and it is certainly worth every penny.

While still providing the cooling needed to maintain the overclocking speeds of the Ryzen 9 5900X, the Corsair H115i offers both style and longevity.

This all-in-one liquid cooler makes use of a two RGB 140 mm, magnetic levitation, PWM fans, which can output an incredible 97 CFM of airflow and 1.27 mmH2O of static pressure.

These fans are also equipped with 16 individually controlled RGB LEDs, and operate at 400-2400 RPM. They are utilized to cool the liquid within a 280 mm all-aluminum radiator, which is subsequently transferred to the CPU until it is heated, and then transferred back to the radiator to be cooled again.

The best cooling and style that a liquid CPU cooling has to offer, the Corsair H115i RGB Platinum can currently be found for $169.99.
